title: Grand Canyon North Rim 4-Day
subtitle: Take in the unforgettable views of the Grand Canyon's wild northern borders!
description: Take in the unforgettable views of the Grand Canyon's wild northern borders! On this tour we explore the remote Kaibab Plateau rising high above the magnificent Grand Canyon. We'll ride through ponderosa and aspen forests on a fun 2 day section of the Arizona Trail leading up to our first view of the Canyon at its East Rim. We then traverse the plateau to finish the last days of the tour on the magnificent Rainbow Rim Trail. This is mountain biking at its best with winding singletrack and stunning views into the Grand Canyon. The combination of high desert vistas, forest trails and alpine meadows make for an incredibly scenic route. Riders of varying abilities will enjoy the terrain that offers a choice of riding options from secluded forest roads to more challenging singletrack. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Courthouse Loop
subtitle: Spectacular views of Arches National Park
description: This tour is a great introduction to mountain biking in Moab! Spectacular views of Arches National Park and gently rolling terrain on wide, doubletrack make this ride perfect for beginners and families. Many riders are able to try the Rusty Spur Trail, just off the main loop, as their first foray into singletrack terrain. Whether you're new to the sport or just looking for an easy cruise, our guides will be happy to help you improve your skills. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. COURTHOUSE PHOTO GALLERY
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Arizona’s Sonoran Desert
subtitle: Extend your riding season with our early and late winter tour dates
description: Looking for winter mountain biking tours in the sun? Arizona's Sonoran Desert is the perfect place to escape the winter doldrums and Rim Mountain Bike Tours is the best outfitter providing multi-day, camping-based, winter cycling tours in the sun. In the northern states, cycling during the winter can be exhilarating (and brisk!) but sometimes you just want to feel the warm winter sun on your back as you cruise an awesome, smooth and rolling singletrack through hillsides dotted with shapely saguaros and spiny ocotillo cacti. Our early and late winter tour dates will extend your riding season as you witness the earliest wildflower show anywhere in the USA. We will explore McDowell Mountain Park and the Sonoran Preserve with views of the nearby Superstition Mountains as well as travel to the area's best rides. This tour features warm temperatures, abundant wildlife and superb desert singletrack. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Arizona's Sonoran Desert Photo Gallery
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Dead Horse Point State Park
subtitle: Classic Intermediate Singletrack with big views of the Colorado River and The Canyonlands
description: Dead Horse Point is one of Utah’s most spectacular state parks and offers a great taste of what Moab mt biking is all about. Towering 2,000 feet above the Colorado River, the park provides a breathtaking panorama of the Canyonlands area with sculpted pinnacles and buttes. This super fun introduction to singletrack has rolling terrain, mixed with some short climbs and lots of fun sections to cruise on. Some previous mountain bike experience is highly recommended. We enjoy the Intrepid Trail in the morning on our half-day tours. On our full-day tours we include lunch at the park’s main viewpoint and finish our day on the more challenging Twisted Tree and Prickly Pear trail segments on the west side of the park. For further details, view any of the items below: Dead Horse Point Singletrack Photo Gallery
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Canyonlands National Park Full Day
subtitle: A largely downhill route with some challenging climbs and a trailside lunch at Thelma and Louise Point
description: This super scenic tour is a great way to experience mountain biking in Moab with vehicle support! There are spectacular views of Canyonlands National Park on the initial descent as we ride a small portion of the famous White Rim Trail. With some challenging climbs, exciting descents and a trailside lunch at Thelma and Louise Point, riders of differing abilities, with good fitness, will enjoy this full day adventure through the red rock country. Four person minimum required for this tour and is only offered in the Spring and Fall. Please call or email for availability. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Canyonlands National Park Full Day Photo Gallery
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: The Maze 5-Day
subtitle: Like nothing else... where outlaws escaped into wildly remote and inaccessible canyons
description: Simply stated, the Maze is like nothing else. Legends of the old west tell stories of outlaws escaping into its wildly remote and inaccessible canyons. Our ride begins atop the Orange Cliffs with distant views of snow-capped mountains and a glimpse of the rugged terrain we'll soon encounter. Our two-night stay at the Maze Overlook will convince you there is not a more beautiful spot anywhere. The riding is as fun as anything you might find on Moab's classic trails. Both tours provide a full day of hiking through the heart of the Maze and past the Chocolate Drops formation. The six day tour allows time for a hike to the Great Gallery, a world-renowned example of ancient "Barrier Canyon" rock art. Book the 6-day version here! For 2026, our tours will have some variety in the campsite selection. Some tours will utilize Golden Stairs campsite on the 1st night, leaving day 2 as a longer ride-and-hike day, camping at the Maze Overlook above the Harvest scene. These trips are designated on the reservations calender with "Maze (5) day Golden Stairs". There will also be a 4-day version visiting the spectacular high-camp "Panorama Point" before descending the Flint Trail to Golden Stairs camp and then on to Teapot Rock. This will be a fun alternative Maze or an option for a shorter visit. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: The Maze Photo Gallery Each photo has a text description at the bottom. Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Bryce to Zion
subtitle: Travel the spectacular canyon country between two of Utah's most stunning National Parks!
description: Travel the spectacular canyon country between two of Utah's most stunning National Parks! We'll begin our adventure on the Virgin River Rim Trail, a sensational singletrack trail winding through pine & aspen groves, with views of the cliffs of Zion in the distance. Then it's on to Red Canyon, riding beneath blazing pink cliffs and wildly eroded rock formations known as Hoodoos, just outside Bryce Canyon National Park. The backcountry terrain we cover between the two parks is beautiful. Singletrack enthusiasts will love this ride and options are available each day for less experienced riders. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Bryce to Zion Photo Gallery
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Kokopelli Trail
subtitle: From singletrack to slickrock, pinyon pines to aspens
description: This is a journey through the lands of the mythical "Kokopelli" or wandering flute player exemplified in Southwest rock art. Our route ranges from singletrack to slickrock, aspens to pinyon pines and offers sights that will wow your senses and terrain that will definitely test your riding skills. The Kokopelli Trail begins with challenging singletrack, leading to fun, rugged 4 wheel drive trails that touch periodically on the Colorado River. From the Top of the World we descend into Fisher Valley and Onion Creek Canyon, one of the most beautiful and colorful spots in Moab's Canyon Country. The final day offers a choice of riding Moab's legendary Porcupine Rim or Slickrock Trails. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: Photo Gallery Each photo has a text description at the bottom. Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Durango – Colorado Trail Singletrack
subtitle: If you're looking for the most extreme guided mountain biking tour, you've found it
description: Durango's Colorado Trail Tour combines some of the best continuous technical singletrack there is and defines backcountry mountain biking. If you're looking for the most extreme guided mountain biking tour, you've found it. Elevations are high, between 9,000 and 12,000 feet and the views are amazing with the entire San Juan range expanding before you. Rewarding your effort is the final day's "kick ass" 5,000-foot descent. The views include gorgeous basins of wildflowers with backdrops of red mountains, deep green forests and alpine lakes. Our 5-day trip adds the classic Hermosa Creek Trail as a great warm-up ride. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Durango - Colorado Trail Photo Gallery
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Sunrise Downhill
subtitle: Perfect for those without a lot of mountain biking experience
description: Even though this tour leaves town at the crack of dawn, the magnificent views are worth waking up for! Join us for this memorable sunrise tour, complete with a delicious continental-style breakfast, unparalleled scenic vistas and a fun descent (3500 feet elevation loss!) down into Moab. This tour is perfect for those without a lot of mountain biking experience. That said, all riders need to be comfortable using hand brakes as well as be fit enough to pedal up some rising terrain. Four person minimum required for this tour . Please call or email for availability.
prices: Price does not include tax or guide gratuity.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: White Rim 4-Day
subtitle: The White Rim Trail, Island in the Sky district, Canyonlands National Park
description: The White Rim Trail, located in the Island in the Sky district of Canyonlands National Park, is truly a special place. This classic tour is a must for anyone visiting Utah's canyon country, offering a perfect combination of great riding and spectacular scenery. We ride along the "White Rim" layer of sandstone, with dramatic canyons below and majestic red rock cliffs above. The trail leads to arches, towers and other fantastic rock formations. Your guides will lead you on bike and on foot to explore the hidden treasures the White Rim offers. Visit an Indian dwelling of ancient times or perhaps trek into a slot canyon disappearing into the desert sandstone. The White Rim is the trip of a lifetime. On the four-day tour, we ride approximately 20 - 25 miles each day. On the three-day tour, we ride approximately 30 - 35 miles each day. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: Photo Gallery Each photo has a text description at the bottom. Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Gooseberry Mesa 3-Day
subtitle: Ride southwestern Utah's newest slickrock and singletrack trails!
description: Ride southwestern Utah's newest slickrock and singletrack trails! Our tour explores the fantastic network of trails found on Gooseberry Mesa and beyond. The technical and challenging riding weaves through varied terrain of open slickrock and pinyon/juniper forests. The views are spectacular with the dramatic backdrop of Zion National Park in the distance. The Gooseberry Mesa Tour offers experienced riders a perfect opportunity to test their singletrack skills in the early spring or late fall at a comfortable elevation around 5,000 ft. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: Gooseberry Mesa Photo Gallery Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Gooseberry Mesa 4-Day
subtitle: Ride southwestern Utah's newest slickrock and singletrack trails!
description: Ride southwestern Utah's newest slickrock and singletrack trails! Our tour explores the fantastic network of trails found on Gooseberry Mesa and beyond. The technical and challenging riding weaves through varied terrain of open slickrock and pinyon/juniper forests. The Gooseberry Mesa Tour offers experienced riders a perfect opportunity to test their singletrack skills in the early spring or late fall at a comfortable elevation around 5,000 ft. title: Durango Intermediate Singletrack
subtitle: Awesome singletrack on the lower elevations of the Colorado Trail
description: Durango Colorado has one of the best mountain bike trail systems anywhere! Our intermediate tour will showcase awesome singletrack found at lower elevations than our Colorado Trail Tour, yet we'll still ride some of the best trails this remarkable area offers, including Hermosa Creek Trail, parts of the Colorado Trail and a mostly all day descent to Junction Creek. We return each evening to a comfortable base camp located at Junction Creek.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Best of Crested Butte Inn Tour
subtitle: World-class mountain biking with the opportunity to sample local dining and lodging
description: Join us for a tour of Crested Butte's legendary trails! This "best of" tour combines world-class mountain biking with the opportunity to sample local dining and lodging. Each day our professional guides will show you one of the area's best rides; along the way you'll improve your mountain biking skills, enjoy a delicious trailside lunch, and take in Crested Butte's magnificent scenery. After a full day on the trail, we'll meet for dinner at a local restaurant. Our itinerary is flexible to give you the best experience for your style of riding and we think you'll fall in love with the picturesque mountain town and want to return time and again. Descriptive Video
prices: • 3 nights of lodging (single supplement is extra)
afternoon to evening, day 1, then 3 full days of riding)
• 1 evening dinner meal at a restaurant
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Crested Butte eMTB Singletrack/Campout
subtitle: Featuring longtime favorites Teocalli Ridge, Reno Ridge and more excellent ebike rides
description: "The Butte" is one of the best places you will ever ride, period. This is the place to experience pristine singletrack that has been featured in bike magazines since the inception of the Pearl Pass ride in 1976. Our trail choices are longtime favorites including Teocalli Ridge, Reno Ridge, Brush Creek and more. You'll view mountain peaks in every direction as well as the best wildflower show in Colorado. Camp each day is beside a roaring creek, and within moments of the trail. Elevations range from 9,000 to 12,000 feet with mileage ranging from 17-30 miles a day. Plan an extra day or two to take in one of the many summer festivals and to explore the picturesque town of Crested Butte. We have been loving Ebikes in the Crested Butte high country, and can't wait to share more of it with you all. We are pioneering backcountry ebike adventures and our solar-battery charging systems will keep the batteries charged up. eBikes are allowed on motorized trails in the Crested Butte area on Gunnison National Forest Lands. Fortunately, many classic rides are part of this fantastic network, but not 401, or Doctors Park. Expect to get off the beaten path, ride new trails, and maybe an extra lap of your favorite too. These singletrack trails are Upper Intermediate riding, but can be tailored to the group's interests. Descriptive Video
prices: + Santa Cruz Ebike rental is additional
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Best of Fruita Mnt. Bike Inn Tour
subtitle: Join us in western Colorado's hot spot for great mountain biking in the hills and fun evenings in town
description: Join us in western Colorado's hot spot for great mountain biking in the hills and fun evenings in town. Fruita's well designed trail system with plenty of singletrack awaits us with options for differing abilities from moderate to advanced terrain. Gorgeous views of the Colorado River along sections of the Kokopelli Trail and riding at the base of the dramatic Book Cliffs are among the highlights. Two nights are spent with the group at the area's better restaurants reminiscing on the days' adventures. Itineraries can be customized for private groups of 6 or more and we can easily accommodate riders with varying ability levels. Descriptive Video
prices: • standard bike rental for 3 days of riding
• 3 nights of lodging (single supplement is extra)
• 2 evening dinner meals at a restaurant
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

We then traverse the plateau to finish the last days of the tour on the magnificent Rainbow Rim Trail. This is mountain biking at its best with winding singletrack and stunning views into the Grand Canyon. The combination of high desert vistas, forest trails and alpine meadows make for an incredibly scenic route. title: Best of Moab Mnt. Bike Inn Tour
subtitle: Each day our professional guides will show you one of the area's best rides
description: This "best of" tour combines world-class mountain biking on Moab's legendary trails with the opportunity to sample local dining and lodging. Each day our professional guides will show you one of the area's best rides; along the way you'll improve your mountain biking skills, enjoy a delicious trailside lunch, and take in Moab's magnificent scenery. After a full day on the trail, we'll return to comfortable lodging and in the evening gather for dinner at one of Moab's many fine restaurants. Itineraries can be customized for private groups of 6 or more and we can easily accommodate riders with varying ability levels. Also, if you have a group of road bikers and would like a road bike version of the Best of Moab, we would be happy to set one up for you.
prices: • 3 nights of lodging (single supplement is extra)
afternoon to evening, day 1, then 3 full days of riding)

title: Black Canyon Trail
subtitle: Exciting long-distance singletrack classified as an IMBA Epic Ride and a National Recreation Trail
description: Join Rim Tours for a fantastic mountain bike journey through the upper Sonoran Desert between Scottsdale and Sedona, including the Sonoran Preserve and Black Canyon Trails. The sometimes challenging intermediate terrain hosts saguaro forests and rugged canyons and offers exciting long-distance singletrack that is classified as an IMBA Epic Ride and a National Recreation Trail. We will meet in Phoenix so travel shouldn’t be hard to arrange to whisk you from cold winter temps to sunshine and short sleeves. We start with 2 mellow days warming up in Scottsdale at McDowell Regional Park, then head north to the start of the Black Canyon Trail, where we spend 3 days on The Black Canyon Trail and staying at the historic Bumblebee dude ranch. Expect pokey cactus, potential water crossings and challenging riding. The Black Canyon Trail is an advanced route.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Klondike Bluff
subtitle: A classic Moab ride! You'll gain elevation as you “get your pedal on”
description: This is a classic Moab ride! You'll gain elevation (approximately 700 ft.) as you “get your pedal on” up toward the boundary of Arches National Park. Having a very good fitness base will help you enjoy this ride. Keep your eyes open for the dinosaur tracks embedded in sandstone along the way. Riders will experience a variety of Moab’s unique terrain including slickrock and short technical rocky sections. At the top of the climb, a short hike takes us into a remote area of the park and breathtaking views of the colorful bluffs below. Remember, the return ride is almost all downhill! For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Klondike Bluff Trail Photo Gallery
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Moab Brands Trails Singletrack
subtitle: Mix and match singletrack riding in small doses
description: New for 2026, E-Bikes are now allowed on Moab's singletrack network of trails ! Enjoy riding Santa Cruz full suspension E-Bikes on fun and challenging singletrack. Are you looking to test out some singletrack riding in small doses? Mix and match trails like the Rusty Spur, Lazy EZ (moderate), North 40 (intermediate) and Deadman’s Ridge (advanced). Your guide will combine just the right routes to match your ability level. Descriptive Video
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Oregon Cascade Mountain Singletrack
subtitle: Exceptional singletrack, moderate elevations, gorgeous volcanic created mountains
description: Oregon's Central Cascade range features a high desert climate with a striking landscape of snow capped volcanic peaks, blue alpine lakes and forests of lodge pole and ponderosa pine. Best of all, this area also hosts a beautiful trail system. With trail elevations below 7,000 feet, this tour offers riders exceptional singletrack at moderate elevations. From our meeting point in Bend, we'll explore the intricate trail system not far out of town and then move on to the Mt. Bachelor and Cascade Lakes area west of Bend and Sun River. All of our rides boast remarkably well maintained trails, gorgeous vistas of nearby volcanic created mountains, few fellow travelers to meet on the trails and pristine lakes with fishing opportunities for the angler/mt. biker. Join us to discover why this is our new summer favorite riding local!
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: E-Kokopelli Singletrack
subtitle: Traversing the rock rims above the Colorado River, sometimes technical and narrow trails
description: On this new tour we will use e-bikes to explore the best Singletracks along the route of The Kokopelli Trail from Fruita, CO to Moab, UT. Backcountry campsites allow ample time to take in the majestic corridor of the Colorado river at the Utah/CO border. Highlights include Fruita's 18 Road, home of boundless flow and some of the most "pure fun" trails anywhere. Ebikes will allow us to hit tons of trail, and say yes to extra laps. We'll then make our way towards "Rabbit Valley" and the Western Rim trail, t raversing the rock rims above the Colorado River, the sometimes technical and narrow trails climb and descend through high desert terrain with expansive vistas towards Moab. As we develop and perfect this new trip, the itinerary is subject to change to create the best experience.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Grand Staircase-Escalante
subtitle: Camping-based touring in South Central Utah near Grand Staircase-Escalante NM
description: The Grand Staircase-Escalante, one of Utah's newest National Monuments, defies description with its varied and remote terrain. The riding is mostly moderate but includes a few challenging sections of trail with short steep climbs and descents and rocky or sandy washes at between 4,000 - 7,000 feet elevation. We start our adventure in Boulder, Utah with a rolling downhill ride on the Burr Trail through the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument. The ride continues with great swooping climbs and descents interspersed with sweeping views of the Waterpocket Fold, the Henry Mountains and Navajo Mountain. We'll visit the Wolverine Petrified Wood Area, Capitol Reef National Park and hike through Upper Muley Twist Canyon. We end with a downhill run to Bullfrog Bay, on the shores of Lake Powell. We camp in two different locations. This is a perfect tour for a mixed abilities group or for those looking for a relaxed pace of travel. Mileage each day varies with options and short hikes allow us time off our bikes to explore hidden canyon trails. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: Grand Staircase-Escalante Photo Gallery Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Needles to Moab Canyonlands Tour
subtitle: Remote route along a rugged 4-wheel drive road from the Needles past Lockhart Basin to Moab
description: Join us for a 4-day backcountry adventure in Moab's canyon country! We'll ride from the Needles District of Canyonlands National Park to Moab. With its primitive spirit and Wild West atmosphere, our ride past towering hoodoos and otherworldly rock formations through Lockhart Basin offers the perfect getaway. This remote route loosely follows the Colorado River, along a rugged 4-wheel drive road that offers mountain bikers a fun and mostly moderate tour. Fantastic views of canyons, mesas, buttes, and spires, wide-open spaces, and solitude define this backcountry tour. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: Needles to Moab Photo Gallery Each photo has a text description at the bottom. Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Bears Ears Backcountry Tour 4-Day
subtitle: Celebrate our new national monument. From the Bears Ears, follow Elk Ridge down to colorful desert near the Needles District, Canyonlands NP
description: Join us for an unsurpassed 4-day Bears Ears adventure! Our route begins below the 8,000 foot Bears Ears Pass, surrounded by ponderosa pine, and follows Elk Ridge, the backbone between the Abajo Mountains and the Colorado River. We'll explore secluded canyons, rich in cultural history of the Anasazi people, searching for ancient rock art and cliff dwellings. The landscape changes from cool alpine to colorful desert after our dramatic descent to the boundary of Canyonlands National Park. Our final night is spent at this area's most beautiful campsite, Cathedral Butte. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: PHOTO GALLERY Each photo has a text description at the bottom. Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Vehicle Support Services
subtitle: For those who do not want a guide, but need a way to carry their gear
description: Some General information on Support/Sag trips: Many groups wish to run their own trips but don't have the means to haul their gear into the backcountry. Rim Tours offers the option where we carry your gear and you can also rent any or all of the camping gear that you might need. Please see below for more details. Our service includes a truck and driver for Moab area trips. There are additional costs for renting gear and for travel to tours outside the Moab area. Please contact us for quotes. For White Rim trips, you must secure your own camping permit. Contact Canyonlands National Park to do so at 435-259-4351 You are hiring a driver, not a guide. You should not expect a "guided trip" from your driver or expect them to be with you at all times. You can work out the general day's plan with your driver so everyone is clear on what is going on and where you will be meeting up together again. Because of limited space in the support vehicle, you will have to provide your own transportation to the start of the ride or arrange a shuttle with us. We will be supplying an open pickup-up truck with a rack system that can carry up to 4 bikes and has sides to keep your gear contained within the rack and pick-up bed. The sides double as tables which you can use.
prices: $1100/day base price for Moab area - Truck, driver, gas, before guide-driver gratuity.

$1500/day Full "Rig" - Truck Complete camp kit: full kitchen, up to 4 large coolers with iced with blocks, three burner stove, extra propane, water jugs with 2.5-3 gallons water/day, hand-wash station, plates, bowls, cups, utensils, as well as serving and cooking utensils. Camp Chairs, condiments, spices, and trash/recycle service.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Navajo Rocks
subtitle: Gorgeous slickrock terrain challenges as well as twisting dirt singletrack
description: New for 2026, E-Bikes are now allowed on Moab's singletrack network of trails ! Enjoy riding Santa Cruz full suspension E-Bikes on fun and challenging singletrack. This trail system opened up in 2014 and has introduced yet another “Wow!” factor to Moab mountain biking. A solid intermediate ride, the trail segments include a taste of almost everything that Moab has to offer: gorgeous slickrock terrain, twisting and turning dirt singletrack, ledgy and punchy climbs, and short steep, rocky descents. Riding along the upper end of Sevenmile Canyon and soaking in views of the Monitor and Merrimac buttes with La Sal Mtns in the background will not disappoint. The trails are extensive enough to make a great Full Day Tour as well.
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: North Klondike Singletrack
subtitle: Wind through towering rock outcroppings, rip along buffed mesas and roll over perfectly designed drop-offs
description: New for 2026, E-Bikes are now allowed on Moab's singletrack network of trails ! Enjoy riding Santa Cruz full suspension E-Bikes on fun and challenging singletrack. Top riders from around the world proclaim the North Klondike trails as some of the best and most fun in Moab. Trails such as Alaska, Mega Steps and Dino Flow wind through narrow wedges in towering rock outcroppings, rip along buffed mesas and roll over perfectly designed drop-offs. There is plenty of climbing and descending to satisfy all types of riders and the variety of trails allows for moderate to more extreme experiences in the same area. To extend your riding time, see our full day tours option. Descriptive Video
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: KlonZo Trails
subtitle: A great introduction to Moab singletrack with a carnival-like atmosphere
description: New for 2026, E-Bikes are now allowed on Moab's singletrack network of trails ! Enjoy riding Santa Cruz full suspension E-Bikes on fun and challenging singletrack. The South Klonzo Trails offer a carnival-like atmosphere on trails such as Houdini and Roller Coaster which are a great introduction to Moab singletrack. Moderate riders will enjoy a morning of fun on a variety of packed dirt, slickrock and winding singletrack trails. For riders with a little more experience and stamina, ride the North trails and pedal on rockier terrain. The Wahoo and Gravitron segments will leave you with a huge smile on your face at the end of this great tour! For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Klonzo Trails Photo Gallery
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Bartlett Wash
subtitle: One of the largest open slickrock areas you’ll ever see
description: New for 2026, E-Bikes are now allowed on Moab's singletrack network of trails ! Enjoy riding Santa Cruz full suspension E-Bikes on fun and challenging singletrack. Looking to improve your technical riding skills and ride some of Utah’s finest slickrock terrain? Lots of dips, bowls and drops on this open riding terrain, make this tour a veritable slickrock playground, and our guides will be happy to give you the tips you'll need to master it. Hidden canyons, beautiful red sandstone, and unique terrain on one of the largest open slickrock areas you’ll ever see make this ride a local's favorite. We guarantee you'll love it too! Descriptive Video
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Sovereign Trail
subtitle: Singletrack that rolls over endless rock gardens and twists around larger rock formations
description: The Sovereign Trail offers beautiful stretches of singletrack that roll over endless rock gardens and twist around larger rock formations. You'll challenge yourself on small ledges, short technical climbs and descents, while improving your bike handling skills. This beautiful trail winds through the desert, and gives views of La Sal Mountains and surrounding areas. This is a ride not to be missed!
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Magnificent 7 Trails Singletrack
subtitle: Slickrock and flowing trails, Gemini Bridges - a newer Moab classic ride
description: New for 2026, E-Bikes are now allowed on Moab's singletrack network of trails ! Enjoy riding Santa Cruz full suspension E-Bikes on fun and challenging singletrack. How about some super fun riding on yet another Moab classic ride? Multiple trail sections allow us to ride a variety of terrain with some slickrock and flowing trails that offer spectacular views along the canyon rims. Take a break at Gemini Bridges and soak in the twin arches formed by water over the ages. Mag 7 has options that make it a great ride for an incredible half day tour, or extend the your riding time with an awesome Full Day Tour adventure. This tour is typically ridden as a loop and does not include the shuttled ride with the Portal segment. Descriptive Video
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Slickrock Trail
subtitle: A series of petrified sand dunes makes for an 11 mile long roller coaster ride
description: The Slickrock Trail is one of the most unique rides anywhere and has helped make Moab the mountain biking Mecca that it is. A series of petrified sand dunes has formed the trail into an 11 mile long roller coaster ride. This trail has incredible vistas as well as extremely steep ascents, descents and side slopes that will test your mountain bike skills and fitness.If you are interested in riding this world famous trail, but a bit daunted by its reputation, our slickrock-savvy guides can help! We know this terrain and our experienced instructors would be happy to help you improve your technique. Route Video
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Amasa Back / Ahab
subtitle: Climb for 1,200 vertical feet over ledgy slickrock, descend famous Captain Ahab
description: New for 2026, E-Bikes are now allowed on Moab's singletrack network of trails ! Enjoy riding Santa Cruz full suspension E-Bikes on fun and challenging singletrack. Amasa Back had been a favorite ride since the beginning and now has a world class upgrade with singletrack routes uphill on the Hymasa Trail, and downhill on the much buzzed about Captain Ahab Trail. The classic technical jeep trail still challenges any rider’s ability and climbs for 1,200 vertical feet over ledgy slickrock offering amazing views of the Colorado River, “Behind the Rocks” and La Sal Mts. at the top. Depending on the day and what your skill set is, we have what you want with this smorgasbord of extreme riding. Offered in both half-day and full-day versions, the full-day tour travels out the mesa to Pothole Arch and returns via Captain Ahab or the gnarlier Rock Stacker and Jackson Trails. Half-day Route Video (Hymasa/Ahab)
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Whole Enchilada/Porcupine Rim
subtitle: Renowned epic ride: rugged mountain, flowy technical, unforgiving drops
description: This world-renowned epic ride has it all -- rugged & remote mountain terrain, flowy and technical singletrack and unforgiving red rock drops on multiple sections. The entire route is 28 miles, with the highest point at 11,200 ft and the lowest point at 4,200 ft along the Colorado River. However, depending on the time of year and trail conditions, shuttles will put in at the highest available trailhead. The Whole Enchilada trail system includes the following trail segments, in descending order: Burro Pass (usually available July – Oct), Hazzard County, Kokopelli Down, UPS, LPS and Porcupine Rim. Our guides will show you the lines and ensure your experience is the best it can be, even if it means cutting out portions of the journey. This ride will test your skills and your stamina as there is over 2,000 ft of climbing in this “pedally downhill” ride. Exit options along the route lead to alternate trails that can provide a less extreme riding experience. Additional shuttle charges will apply. Important, please read: Whole Enchilada Disclaimer Route Video
depart_location: Standard full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally, and will also depend on shuttle time.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Porcupine Rim
subtitle: This ride has it all! Join us for a fast-paced descent on some of the best terrain Moab has to offer
description: This ride has it all! Join us for a fast-paced descent on some of the best terrain Moab has to offer. Ledges, drops, and a great section of technical singletrack all combine to make Porcupine Rim an outstanding world-famous ride. While there is a significant overall loss of elevation on this route you will definitely still need to do some pedaling. Don't forget to pause for the remarkable views of Castle Valley, Castleton Tower and the Colorado River along the way! Additional shuttle fees apply. Route Video
depart_location: Standard full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally, and will also depend on shuttle time.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: White Rim in a Day
subtitle: Only for the extremely fit: long hours in the saddle
description: This tour is truly only for the extremely fit. This route is typically an excellent 3 or 4 day camping tour for everyone else. For those looking to challenge themselves over long hours in the saddle, our expert guides will show you the way, tell lots of stories and bring you in hopefully before dark. You will need to consult with our office staff before you can book this tour. This incredibly beautiful and remote place means a long walk out if things go wrong. Vehicle support is offered for this ride as an option.
prices: Due to the variety of options, please call for pricing
Price does not include tax or guide gratuity.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Pedal & Paddle
subtitle: A combo of mountain biking and rafting on the Colorado River
description: This can be done in one-day for people who want to do and see as much as possible in a short time frame. You may also go biking one day and rafting or kayaking another. The package is priced as a half day mountain bike tour of your choice, and river activity of your choice. If you want the combo in one day: It begins with a morning mountain bike ride that takes you on some of Moab’s best terrain. You’ll finish the day with the river portion. The two main river options are: White Water Rafting where your guide does the paddling and you relax and enjoy the ride, or Kayaking where you get an “upper body workout” as you paddle in a solo or tandem inflatable kayak down a beautiful section of the Colorado River. It’s helpful if you have a little riding or paddling experience, but advanced skills are not necessary. River portion is provided by a local professional outfitter. Note about dates: During May through mid-September, the two activities can occur on the same day (biking AM, river activity PM.) During early spring (April) and from September 17 on, there is not enough time to do both tours on the same day. If that's when you are visiting, you have three options: choose two different dates. ask us to book the bike tour as a private tour so that it can be customized to fit with your afternoon river activity. if you're not sure about the river activity, simply book your bike tour using the "Book Tour" button on the tour of your choice (go to the upper menu bar, select Day Tour and then the Tour of our choice.) As you are booking that tour, add a note that you'd like to convert it into a Pedal & Paddle and we will help you from there on the river activity.
prices: Pricing of the River Activity portion may vary - please inquire
3 persons for rafting, ages 5 and up
2 persons for kayaking, ages 10 and up
Price does not include tax or guide gratuity.
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Instructional Tour
subtitle: Moab has unique terrain and our professional guides can help you learn and improve your skills
description: Moab is a great place to improve your riding and experience our other-worldly landscape. Learn how best to tackle our unique terrain from the experts. No matter what your ability, Rim Tours’ guide staff will help refine what you already know and teach you the how-tos for the ride you are on, from basic mountain bike riding skills to more advanced drop-offs, switchbacks and other techniques appropriate for your experience level. We will pick the best trails where we can work specifically on skills for your level and have an awesome ride as we practice. Rim Tours’ Instructional Tours are predominantly trail rides where we spend initial time working on basics and then focus on skill building opportunities along the route, stopping to learn and practice as we continue on the trail. If you are more interested in a more in-depth skills clinic where the majority of your time will be spent on mastering techniques and less time on the actual ride, we recommend contacting our friends at Momentum Mountain Biking for instruction by the hour, day or weekend.
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Desert Sunrise
subtitle: Perfect For Those Without A Lot Of Mountain Biking Experience
description: Even though this tour leaves town at the crack of dawn, the magnificent views and desert sunrise are worth waking up for! Join us for this memorable sunrise tour, complete with a delicious continental-style breakfast, unparalleled scenic vistas and a fun easy route through amazing desert terrain, including some sections of slickrock. This tour is perfect for those without a lot of mountain biking experience. That said, all riders need to be comfortable using hand brakes as well as be fit enough to pedal up some rising terrain. It will include about 2.5 hours of pedaling time. Four person minimum required for this tour. This tour is offered on a custom basis only. Please call or email for availability. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. DESERT SUNRISE PHOTO GALLERY
prices: This tour is offered on a custom basis only.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Bears Ears Mnt. Bike Weekend 3-Day
subtitle: Celebrate our new national monument. From the Bears Ears, follow Elk Ridge down to colorful desert near the Needles District, Canyonlands NP
description: Join us for an unsurpassed 3-day Bears Ears adventure! Our route begins below the 8,000 foot Bears Ears Pass, surrounded by ponderosa pine, and follows Elk Ridge, the backbone between the Abajo Mountains and the Colorado River. We'll explore secluded canyons, rich in cultural history of the Anasazi Indians, searching for ancient rock art and cliff dwellings. The landscape changes from cool alpine to colorful desert after our dramatic descent to the boundary of Canyonlands National Park. Our final night is spent at this area's most beautiful campsite, Cathedral Butte. For those considering doing a multi-day tour for their first time, especially those who have little or no camping experience, we've written a detailed description of what it's like to go on a multi-day tour with us. Click here to read it . For further details about this particular tour, view any of the below items: PHOTO GALLERY Each photo has a text description at the bottom. Double-click the first photo, then right-arrow through the sequence for a step-by-step preview of the entire tour.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Sierra Buttes California 4-Day
subtitle: Singletrack, alpine lakes, climbs and downhill runs in Northern California's Sierra Nevada Mountains
description: From our lakeside base camp in the Tahoe National Forest northeast of Yuba City, CA, each day will feature shuttles to the area’s world-class singletracks, including several lengthy downhill runs like the Downieville Downhill (intermediate to technical). Other days will feature a mix of climbs and descents through mossy forests with vast views of alpine lakes, fast and flowy singletracks with sweeping banked turns, occasional rock slabs and natural bumps, and cross-country loops. Rides may include high-speed sections with long sight lines, tabletop jumps for those who love air time and finishing at creek-side swimming holes, though all rides can be taken at a more mellow pace – you can make it easier or harder, depending on your skill and comfort level. For further details about this tour view any of the below items: Photo Gallery Descriptive Videos
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Sierra Buttes California 5-Day
subtitle: Singletrack, alpine lakes, climbs and downhill runs in Northern California's Sierra Nevada Mountains
description: From our lakeside base camp in the Tahoe National Forest northeast of Yuba City, CA, each day will feature shuttles to the area’s world-class singletracks, including several lengthy downhill runs like the Downieville Downhill (intermediate to technical). Other days will feature a mix of climbs and descents through mossy forests with vast views of alpine lakes, fast and flowy singletracks with sweeping banked turns, occasional rock slabs and natural bumps, and cross-country loops. Rides may include high-speed sections with long sight lines, tabletop jumps for those who love air time and finishing at creek-side swimming holes, though all rides can be taken at a more mellow pace – you can make it easier or harder, depending on your skill and comfort level. For further details about this tour view any of the below items: Photo Gallery Descriptive Videos

title: Private Guided Bike Tour with Photographer
subtitle: Professional photographer join you and your guide to capture your ride
description: A private bike tour with a photographer is a way for you to relax into your ride, keep your hand on the bars and eyes on your line. Why? You might ask… • Because you are biking for a few days with Rim Tours - and you want to celebrate your last day by getting some pro shots you can hang on your wall, and share with your family, friends, and co-workers. • Because you are celebrating something: An anniversary, a birthday, a life milestone. It's your first time in Moab. It’s your special Moab mountain bike trip. A sunset photoshoot on your bike ride is the cherry on top that you can keep forever... • Because this is your first time to Moab And your eyes are wide. Because it’s your forty-sixth time to Moab, you know the magic and finally want that view on your wall. • Because it’s your family vacation. Are you always reaching for your phone that is chronically at 12% and in some pocket somewhere? Are you the one always taking the pictures and never in them? Relax. Your only job now is to ride with the kids. How bout for your next Christmas Card? • Because you are a shredder who wants to share what you do on all your fun trips with your family or co-workers and definitely hang it on your wall. Let’s go biking and get the shots! • Because this is what you and your partner do, you ride bikes and visit cool places! • And of course, you want art for your wall! Really the question is Why Not? With our private tour option, depending on your skill level, you can choose from any of our mtn bike tours. Options to have a photographer & what to expect. Half Day Mountain Bike Tour with a photographer - bike and shoot, Corie will ride ahead, along, and from afar to capture you and your family, friends, or partner on your guided ride. Corie, an avid mountain bike and Moab Local, knows all the right spots! • Up to 3 hours of Corie time • Corie will ride along on your half-day tour • 15 images to view for print Half-Day Photo Session Tour - A photo session on your bike at sunset or sunrise. Corie will take you to a beautiful Moab mountain biking location and make you look your best on your bike. The photo session tour is designed to take photos; you will go to a trail with great photo spots and be featured in the best light. • Up to 3 hours of Corie’s time • 90 min bike portrait session with Corie on one of Moabs beautiful mtn. bike trails. • 50 images to view for prints Have your bike ride and bike portrait session too - Full-Day Tour - Ride with a guide in the morning and have a Sunset Photo Session Bike with a guide in the morning, and for sunset Corie will take you to a trail with great photo locations and the best evening light to photograph you, your family, you and your partner or the whole group on your bikes. • half-day mountain bike tour with a Rim Tours guide • 90 min bike and portrait session with Corie at sunset in one of Moab's beautiful mountain bike locations. • up to 3 hours during the bike and portrait session • 50 images to view for prints *There will be a break between sessions on the full day tour A little about your photographer Corie - You can feel at ease with Corie on the trail, as a mountain bike enthusiast and former backcountry guide here at Rim Tours, she also traveled the west teaching mountain bike skills camps, and is a certified level II (BICP) skills instructor. Originally from Alaska Corie moved to Moab after completing photography school at Colorado Mountain College in pursuit of her passion for mtn. biking. In the past years she has broadened her work to include photography. You can find her in the national parks or out on the trail photographing families, couples, outdoor enthusiasts, and dogs too. See can see all of Corie's Work Samples here What you can expect - • A photo consultation, A Moab mtn. bike ride, a personal reveal meeting, prints delivered to your door, low res digital files of all the images you printed. My services - • a personal consultation - expert advice on mtn.biking and best photo locations • up to three hours of my time on the bike • A reveal meeting - let's get excited together, you look so good to let's print it for your wall. • printing service - I will take care of this and have it delivered to your front door The Photographer Cost is $250 and 3 hours of Corie's time. Prints start at $50, you buy what you want and pricing is discussed in the initial consultation.
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
distance: Half Day 7 - 10 miles / Full Day 15-20 miles
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Moab Bikepacking 101
subtitle: WE ARE OFFERING AN INTRODUCTORY COURSE IN BIKEPACKING THAT WILL TEACH PARTICIPANTS ALL YOU NEED TO SET OUT ON YOUR OWN INDEPENDENT TOURS.
description: Bikepacking is exciting and rewarding form of off-pavement, adventure bike touring. You carry all your gear on the bike, from food/water to camp kit to repairs and navigation. Think ultralight backpacking, but on your mountain bike! We are offering introductory courses in bikepacking that would teach participants all you need to set out on their own independent tours. Given the educational nature of this experience, the layout will look a little different than our classic supported tour offerings. Both courses will cover all the same information and skills, but the riding/shakedown tour portion of each course will be in different levels of terrain challenge. Our May trip will feature intermediate terrain with more challenging climbs and some technical sections of 4x4 roads while the June date will ride on moderate terrain with less technical challenge. Day 1 for both trips facilitates a clinic on preparation and packing for your ride and Days 2-4 will be out on the trail putting it all into practice. Photo Credit: Esther Horanyi & Dana Van Voorhees
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Slickrock Trail E-Bikes
subtitle: A series of petrified sand dunes makes for an 11 mile long roller coaster ride
description: The Slickrock Trail is one of the most unique rides anywhere and has helped make Moab the mountain biking Mecca that it is. A series of petrified sand dunes has formed the trail into an 11 mile long roller coaster ride. This trail has incredible vistas as well as extremely steep ascents, descents and side slopes that will test your mountain bike skills and fitness.If you are interested in riding this world famous trail, but a bit daunted by its reputation, our slickrock-savvy guides can help! We know this terrain and our experienced instructors would be happy to help you improve your technique. Route Video
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally

title: Dead Horse Point Ebike Singletrack
subtitle: Towering 2,000 feet above the Colorado River, a breathtaking panorama with sculpted pinnacles and buttes.
description: Dead Horse Point is one of Utah’s most spectacular state parks and as a state park it is open to Class 1 Ebikes. Towering 2,000 feet above the Colorado River, the park provides a breathtaking panorama of the Canyonlands area with sculpted pinnacles and buttes. This super fun intermediate singletrack has rolling terrain, mixed with some short climbs and lots of fun sections to cruise on. Some previous mountain bike experience is highly recommended. Class 1 Ebikes only at DHP Brand new Santa Cruz Ebikes will take us on an epic ride, and are included with all tours. The pedal-assist bikes ride just like a regular bike and only power when you pedal. This natural feeling boost will help you conquer moves like never before and deliver miles of smiles. Don't let the motor fool you though! All the essential and technical skills of mountain biking still apply, and you will still work up a great sweat. Deadhorse Point trails are primarily rock at times and require intermediate technical skills and previous off-road mountain bike experience. We enjoy the Intrepid Trail in the morning on our half-day tours. On our full-day tours we include lunch at the park’s main viewpoint and finish our day on the more challenging Twisted Tree and Prickly Pear trail segments on the west side of the park.
prices: Deadhorse Point Ebike Half Day or Full Day
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Blue Buffalo Ebike
subtitle: Blue Buffalo - exciting slickrock area with amazing views of Monitor Merrimac, buttes. Uranium Arch is a fun option.
description: This classic Rim Tour gets resurrected for Ebikes in 2023! Ride from the historic Mill Canyon stage station through a small canyon out to vast expanses of slickrock. Ebikes make it a blast to zip up and down the slickrock, and a long-wide open descent back to the vehicles offers plenty of opportunity for high-speed, without exposure or cliffs. This tour is suitable for those riders with some Mtb or off-road cycling experience. If you are looking for another fun Ebike ride, check out Klondike Bluffs Beginner’s Ebike Tour . Blue Buffalo Photo Gallery
prices: Blue Buffalo Ebike is a 1/2 Day Ride
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Slickrock Ebike – Advanced
subtitle: A series of petrified sand dunes makes for an 11 mile long roller coaster ride
description: This Ebike Slickrock Trail Tour is one of the most unique rides anywhere and has helped make Moab the mountain biking Mecca that it is. A series of petrified sand dunes has formed the trail into an 11 mile long roller coaster ride. Ebikes will help us conquer the steep hill climbs, but expect extremely steep descents and side slopes, and exposure that will test your mountain bike skills and fitness. This ride requires advanced technical skills, and intermediate fitness even with Ebikes. If you are interested in riding this world famous trail, but a bit daunted by its reputation, our slickrock-savvy guides can help! We know this terrain and our experienced instructors would be happy to help you improve your technique. Route Video
prices: Slickrock Ebike is a Half Day ride
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally

title: Fruita Ebike Singletrack Weekend
subtitle: Fruita 18rd Singletrack campout
description: Fruita is renowned for its flowy singletrack and Rim Tours has always taken guests there on our Kokopelli tours, and now we are excited to showcase the Ebike Singletrack on tap. World-famous "18 Road" is an incredibly fun system of loops, and is now open to Class 1 Ebikes. We will base camp here and enjoy 3 days of riding. Grand Junction is more easily accessed than Moab, and makes this an ideal getaway. ** Group Trips ** We are happy to offer this trip to private groups at anytime that is best for you, in addition to offering pre-planned group dates. **
prices: • All Food from Lunch Day 1 to Lunch Day 4
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Custom BnB-based Ebike Tour
subtitle: Enjoy the Rim Tours experience, without the Camping
description: Moab - Fruita - St. George/Zion - Crested Butte - Phoenix Since 1985, Rim Tours has specialized in backcountry culinary endeavors, pioneering the multi-day Mountain Bike Adventure. Now we are excited to offer the same personal chef services, without the camping. We want to make it effortless to have the best Mountain Bike experience when you visit our world-class ride destinations. Here’s how it goes: - You tell us when you want to visit, and how many people you are bringing. (Minimum 4 people). - Perfectly Planned - We book your lodging at a great VRBO-style location, giving you private space to enjoy with your group and skipping the hotels - Fully Supported - We bring healthy, gourmet food and ride snacks, provide new carbon fiber Santa Cruz Rental bikes, transport to the trails, shuttles and fun, professional guides to take you to all the best spots. - Custom-Catered It can be hectic to get food in-town. Let us take care of the details. Our trained chef-guides will utilize the input you provide during registration to craft a menu with your favorite foods. We are happy to accommodate most dietary restrictions, such as Gluten-free, vegetarian, vegan, or whole foods, but we will always buy high quality foods and prepare recipes that we practice and refine. Please also tell us what you do like. Our guides will shop specifically for you, and are happy to take requests. - BYOB! Utah law says we can’t provide alcohol, so do import your favorite beverages (highly recommended as selection is more limited than you may be accustomed) or we are happy to stop by the stores with you. - What to Expect - Dinner Night 1 to Last Lunch, trained professional guides taking care of logistics, safety, food and dishes. - Base Price - $2050/pp + Gratuity - (Varies depending on dates and lodging availability) - Tour Options : - Single Occupancy – guests will get their own bed and share rooms. For private rooms add $200/pp , Couples will usually be setup to share, but individual accommodations may vary - ALL Meals – We understand you might want to hit the town for dinner one night, so typically we leave one night’s food up to you, however if your motto is RIDE-EAT-SLEEP-REPEAT, we will take care of all food – $50/pp -4 th Night’s Lodging – We are happy to add another day’s food and lodging for $250/pp. Last night's dinner, Lodging, and Breakfast. Perfect to have a full day 3 days riding and leave the next morning. Airport Pickup – We said we’ll take care of it! You don’t need a rental car if you can walk or ride short distances to town. We pick your group up at the Moab Airport on Day 1 - $250 -Ebikes – We guarantee you’ll love them. They aren’t allowed on all trails yet, so in Moab we recommend doing both styles of bike. If you'd like to do an Ebike only trip, we suggest choosing St. George, UT as your destination. -Own Bikes – Subtract $250 if you will be using your own pedal bike, or $350 for your own Ebike.
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Klondike Bluff Ebike Ride
subtitle: This Ebike tour is a classic Moab ride! You'll gain elevation as you “get your pedal on”
description: A classic Moab ride, made great again with Ebikes! We will warm up with a few miles of cruising road approaching Klondike Bluff, getting used to the ebikes abilities. You'll gain elevation (approximately 700 ft.) as you “get your pedal on” up toward the boundary of Arches National Park. Keep your eyes open for the dinosaur tracks embedded in sandstone along the way. Riders will experience a variety of Moab’s unique terrain including slickrock and short technical rocky sections. At the top of the climb, a short hike takes us into a remote area of the park and breathtaking views of the colorful bluffs below. The return ride is an awesome downhill across vast tilted sandstone. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Klondike Bluff Trail Photo Gallery
prices: Klondike Bluff Ebike is a 1/2 Day Ride
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Ebike Intro Tour
subtitle: AN INTRODUCTORY TOUR THE ELECTRIC WAY! WITH A FOCUS ON FUN!
description: The aim of this tour is to offer a fun learning experience while riding our full-suspension, pedal assist ebikes. If you are newer to mt biking and want to get a taste of all the fun of a Class 1 ebike, then come join us! We will give you a detailed briefing on riding safety and techniques, as well as some practice in the parking area prior to getting out on the tour’s scenic adventure. Along the way, we will discuss, demonstrate, and assist you with any riding questions or difficulties. You will get to ride on terrain that will mostly undulate on a mix of packed dirt, sandstone and rocky terrain – all the favorite features of Moab-style riding! So come on out and join the FUN! For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. E-Bike Intro Tour Photo Gallery [ngg src="galleries" ids="24" display="basic_thumbnail" thumbnail_crop="0" maximum_entity_count="5"]
prices: Intro Ebike Tour is a 1/2 Day Ride

title: Courthouse Loop Ebike
subtitle: Spectacular views of Arches National Park
description: This Ebike tour is a great introduction to mountain biking in Moab! Spectacular views of Arches National Park and gently rolling terrain on wide, doubletrack make this ride perfect for beginners and families. Many riders are able to try the Rusty Spur Trail, just off the main loop, as their first foray into singletrack terrain. Whether you're new to the sport or just looking for an easy cruise, our guides will be happy to help you improve your skills. For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. COURTHOUSE PHOTO GALLERY
prices: Courthouse Loop Ebike is a 1/2 Day Ride
depart_location: half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally
land_agency: This tour is operated under permit with the Moab Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management. Rim Tours is an equal opportunity provider.

title: Canyonlands National Park Ebike Full Day
subtitle: An epic journey into the Canyonlands and back, conquering Shafer Trail with our fleet of Ebikes
description: This super scenic Ebike tour is a great way to experience Moab mountain biking. The Ebikes allow us to plan an out and back from the summit of the massive Shafer Trail, including the big hill climb on the return. We start with an initial descent 1200ft of well maintained road, to join the White Rim trail and head out Musselman Arch, then optional trek to “Thelma and Louise Point”. Returning back to the summit of the Shafer Trail with the La Sal Mountain in the background. *Please note: although Ebikes provide amazing assistance, there are hills to climb on this tour! Remember to save some energy for the return climb back up the Shafer Trail. This tour is a great adventure for differing abilities, with good fitness and some mountain bike experience. We are the Only Company to offer this tour! For further details, view a photo gallery about this tour. Canyonlands National Park Full Day Photo Gallery
depart_location: Standard half and full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies   seasonally

title: Elementary Ebike Tour
subtitle: An elementary tour with Ebikes, focus on FUN
description: The focus is to make this a fun and elementary level tour. We will give you a detailed briefing of riding safety, and techniques, with some practice in the parking area prior to getting out on the tour's scenic adventure. Along the way, we will discuss, demostrate, and assist you with any riding questions or difficulties. Our aim is to provide a fun, and learning experience with Ebikes. Elementary Ebike Photo Gallery

title: Ebike Best of Crested Butte Inn Tour
subtitle: World-class Ebiking in Crested Butte with the opportunity to sample local dining and lodging
description: Join us for an Ebike tour of Crested Butte's legendary trails! This "Best of" Ebike tour combines world-class mountain biking with the opportunity to sample local dining and lodging. Each day our professional guides will show you one of the area's best rides; along the way you'll improve your mountain biking skills, enjoy a delicious trailside lunch, and take in Crested Butte's magnificent scenery. After a full day on the trail, we'll meet for dinner at a local restaurant. Our itinerary is flexible to give you the best experience for your style of riding and we think you'll fall in love with the picturesque mountain town and want to return time and again. Beginner/Moderate Trip: 8/20-23 Descriptive Video
prices: • 3 Days guided riding, transport to trail
• 3 nights of lodging, Double occupancy (single supplement = $275)

title: Raptor Route
subtitle: Raptor Route trails
description: This new 12-mile three trail system offers fun, fast, and flowy intermediate singletrack; Eagle Eye, Hawk's Glide, Falcon Flow, and Kestrel run. Raptor Route trails are near the famous Porcupine rim area, and serve as an easier alternative to enjoy similar terrain. Eagle Eye is the highest point of the Raptor Route, and is 2.3 miles in length. Its access point is at the LPS trailhead on Sand Flats Road. Hawk’s Glide is two miles. Hawk’s Glide has some technical spots that are slightly more advanced. Falcon Flow is 5.7 miles long. The last section, Kestrel Run, the latest addition, is two miles long The tour begins with a shuttle up to the entry point to the Raptor Route trails, and riders will cover the four trail segements (conditions permitting), which ends into either the Raptor parking area, or Kestrel parking area off Sand Flats road. Options may include riding down to Slickrock for the practice loop, and/or riding back to Moab. Additional shuttle charges will apply. Route Video
depart_location: Standard full-day tours depart in the morning — time varies seasonally, and will also depend on shuttle time.

title: Moab Backcountry Singletrack Camp
subtitle: Moab's Best Singletrack Rides, and scenic remote campsites
description: Starting high above Canyonlands National Park at Deadhorse Point State Park, we will connect numerous singletrack trail systems via 4x4 trails and enjoy quiet backcountry camping each night. This trip will create a classic Rim Tours point-to-point tour, while also utilizing as many of the designated mountain bike singletracks as possible along the way. This tour is open to ebikes and non-ebikes on the same trip and is available most any dates for private groups of 8 and up.
